title: JAM Session 1422 Take the Process out of Process Internet Submissions.pdf
docSource: pdf file uploaded by the user.
pageContent: © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Presented by Noah Huckaby, IT Business Analyst  Shorter University  June Date, 2016  #1422 Take the Process out of Process Internet Submissions © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  About Shorter University     EX since 2001     Rome, GA     Private, liberal arts school affiliated with the Georgia Baptist Convention     Traditional Undergraduate Program     Online Undergraduate and Graduate Program     Adult Program with 3 satellite campuses     Approximately 2,00 students © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Housing Application  •   Paper forms  •   No data entered in EX  •   Reports consisted of manual data entry through Excel spreadsheets  •   Anyone could submit form, so it was hard to verify who was really ready to be placed     New Student Orientation Registration  •   Form supported by online third-party  •   Hard to integrate two systems  •   Again, received submissions from students not ready to be registered  •   Expensive  Existing Forms © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Move all forms in-house and 100% paperless     Ability to control who can access and submit forms     Multiple departments need ability to run reports     #1 request- automate the entire process as much as possible!  Goals © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Housing forms  •   Wanted separate form for Housing Application and Commuter Application     Housing     Basic personal information (already in EX), personal preferences and an essay     Commuter     Basic personal information(already in EX), parent information and ability to upload residency verification document     New Student Orientation Registration forms  •   Personal information(already in EX), t-shirt size, guest information, session date and Learning Community preference(3 choices)  What data do we need to collect? © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Created two new custom tables to store the data  •   t_SHU_HOUSING  •   t_SHU_ORIENTATION     Chose to use Student Request submission type because it has the question type option of File Upload.  Create new tables and FormBuilder type © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Make tables available for mapping in EX     Manage Mapping Tables window  •   Add table  •   Assign Submission Type to Student Request     Internet Submissions window  •   Student Request    Review Mapping Details  •   Don’t forget to assign processing rights to at least Admin group © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     The forms only needed to be accessible to Traditional students that had reached deposited stage code     Created new tab in JICS titled “New Students”  •   Created new role shu_stu_trad  •   Created SQL job that added students to role once they hit deposited stage     Added two instances of the Student Forms portlet     Don’t forget to give the role access to EACH instance of the portlet!  Location on JICS? © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     No need to “Process” submission     Used Jenzabar’s Stored Procedure, CUST_TABLES$UPD_SUBMITTED_DATA as a base.  •   Added Cursor at beginning to identify which table to insert data  •   Added Update statement at the end to update SUBMISSION.SUBMISSION_STATUS to H     Created SQL job that automatically inserts the data from any new submissions into custom tables and sets SUBMISSION.SUBMISSION_STATUS = ‘H’  True Automation © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     SQL job that sends an email everyday through sp_send_dbmail of previous day submissions to different departments.  Email Notification © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Giving Users ability to edit data     What if a student wants to change their Orientation session date?     Created an executable in Infomaker     Created SQL role to allow Update permission on t_SHU_ORIENTATION table.     In .exe, Users only have ability to change session_dte and guest info columns © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Contact:  •   Noah Huckaby – IT Business Analyst –   nhuckaby@shorter.edu     SQL to create Custom tables and Stored Procedure available upon request.     Questions?  Additonal Resources
